Title: Blue Velvet
Description: The film concerns a young college student who, returning home to visit his ill father, discovers a severed human ear in a field that leads to him uncovering a vast criminal conspiracy and entering a romantic relationship with a troubled lounge singer. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Genre.Name: Neo-noir
Genre.Description: Neo-noir film directors refer to 'classic noir' in the use of Dutch angles, interplay of light and shadows, unbalanced framing; blurring of the lines between good and bad and right and wrong, and thematic motifs including revenge, paranoia, and alienation. Characters were often conflicted antiheroes, trapped in a difficult situation and making choices out of desperation or nihilistic moral systems. (Source: Snippets from wikipedia.org)

Director.Name: David Lynch
Director.Bio: David Lynch is an American filmmaker, screenwriter, actor and artist. He is known for his mind-bending plots and visuals. His first feature film, Eraserhead (1977) put off many critics and viewers. (Source: britannica.com)

Title: Dune
Description: Based on the novel by Frank Herbert. Set in the distant future, the film chronicles the conflict between rival noble families as they battle for control of the extremely harsh desert planet Arrakis, also known as 'Dune'. The planet is the only source of the drug Spice, which allows prescience and is vital to space travel, making it the most essential and valuable commodity in the universe. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Genre.Name: Sci-fi
Genre.Description: Science fiction (or sci-fi) is a film genre that uses speculative, fictional science-based depictions of phenomena that are not fully accepted by mainstream science, such as extraterrestrial lifeforms, spacecraft, robots, cyborgs, interstellar travel or other technologies. Science fiction films have often been used to focus on political or social issues, and to explore philosophical issues like the human condition. (Source: Snippets from wikipedia.org)

Title: Alien
Description: This film follows the crew of the commercial space tug Nostromo, who, after coming across a mysterious derelict spaceship on an undiscovered moon, find themselves up against an aggressive and deadly extraterrestrial set loose on the their ship. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Director.Name: Ridley Scott
Director.Bio: Ridley Scott is an English film director who got his start as a trainee set designer with the BBC. He began directing with the BBC series 'Z Cars' before founding a television advertising firm with brother Tony Scott. Ridley Scott became interested in directing science fiction films after the success of Star Wars in 1977. (Source: imdb.com)

Title: Blade Runner
Description: Set in the dystopian future of 2019 Los Angeles, in which synthetic humans known as replicants are bio-engineered by the powerful Tyrell Corporation to work on space colonies. When a fugitive group of advanced replicants escapes back to Earth, burnt-out cop Rick Deckard reluctantly agrees to hunt them down. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Genre.Name: Cyberpunk
Genre.Description: Cyberpunk movies are a subgenre of science-fiction cinema and typically take place in a dystopian future. In cyberpunk movies, certain aspects of the social order break down, leading to chaos. These films typically feature advanced, futuristic technology, such as artificial intelligence and virtual reality. (Source: Snippet from masterclass.com)

Title: House of Gucci
Description: The film follows Patrizia Reggiani and Maurizio Gucci, as their romance transforms into a fight for control of the Italian fashion brand Gucci. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Genre.Name: Crime Drama
Genre.Description: A type of drama that focuses on the lives, actions and moral dilemmas of criminals, often stressing the notion that crime doesn''t pay. Unlike crime thrillers, these films usually offer a more serious, grim and realistic portrayal of the criminal environment, emphasizing character development and complex narratives over bloody action sequences, gunplay and violence. (Source: Snippet from allmovie.com)

Title: Lost in Translation
Description: Bob Harris, a fading American movie star in the middle of a midlife crisis, travels to Tokyo to promote Suntory whisky. There, he befriends another estranged American, a recent college graduate named Charlotte. The film explores themes of alienation and disconnection against a backdrop of cultural displacement in Japan. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Genre.Name: Romantic comedy-drama
Genre.Description: Not quite as lighthearted as romantic comedy, but not as serious as romantic drama, romantic comedy-drama falls in between. This genre dives deeper into the conflicting emotions of romance and relationships, while injecting humor and lighter moments. (Source: premiumbeat.com)

Director.Name: Sophia Coppola
Director.Bio: Sophia Coppola is an American filmmaker, actress and daughter of Francis Ford Coppola. She starred as an infant in the original Godfather film (1972) and returned as Michael Corleone's daugher in 'The Godfather Part III'. Coppola won the Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay in 2004 for 'Lost in Translation'. (Source: wikipedia.org)

Title: Terminator 2: Judgement Day
Description: The sequel to The Terminator (1984) and the second installment in the Terminator franchise. The malevolent artificial intelligence Skynet sends a Terminator—a highly advanced killing machine—back in time to 1995 to kill the future leader of the human resistance John Connor when he is a child. The resistance sends back a less-advanced, reprogrammed Terminator to protect Connor and ensure the future of humanity. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Director.Name: James Cameron
Director.Bio: James Cameron is one of the most requested directors in Hollywood. Born in Canada, he moved in the US in 1971. In 1981, he was fired from his first directing job, 'Pirhana 2: The Spawning'. However his 1984 film, 'The Terminator' became one of the most iconic films in history. (Source: imdb.com)

Title: Labyrinth
Description: Sixteen-year old Sarah embarks on a quest to reach the center of an enormous, otherworldly maze to rescue her infant half-brother Toby, whom she wished away to Jareth, the Goblin King. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Fantasy films are films that belong to the fantasy genre with fantastic themes, usually magic, supernatural events, mythology, folklore, or exotic fantasy worlds. The genre is considered a form of speculative fiction alongside science fiction films and horror films, although the genres do overlap. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Director.Name: Jim Henson
Director.Bio: James (Jim) Henson was an American filmmaker, puppeteer, animator, cartoonist, actor and inventor. He achieved international acclaim as the creator of The Muppets and Fraggle Rock (1983-1987) and director of The Dark Crystal (1982) and Labyrinth (1986). (Source: wikipedia.org)

Title: Pan's Labyrinth
Description: This film is set in Spain during the summer of 1944, five years after the Spanish Civil War. Ofelia's stepfather, the Falangist Captain Vidal, hunts the Spanish Maquis who fight against the Francoist regime in the region, while Ofelia's pregnant mother Carmen grows increasingly ill. Ofelia meets several strange and magical creatures who become central to her story, leading her through the trials of the old labyrinth garden. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Genre.Name: Fantasy
Genre.Description: Fantasy films are films that belong to the fantasy genre with fantastic themes, usually magic, supernatural events, mythology, folklore, or exotic fantasy worlds. The genre is considered a form of speculative fiction alongside science fiction films and horror films, although the genres do overlap. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Director.Name: Guillermo del Toro
Director.Bio: Guillermo del Toro is a Mexican filmmaker and author. He won the Academy Award for Best Picture and Best Director for 'The Shape of Water' (2017). del Toro is fascinated by monsters and his films and works often connect fairy tails and horror. (Source: wikipedia.org)

Title: Hellboy
Description: A demonic beast-turned superhero known as Hellboy secretly works to keep the world safe from paranormal threats with his team, the Bureau of Paranormal Research and Defense. (Source: Snippet from wikipedia.org)

Genre.Name: Superhero
Genre.Description: The superhero genre focuses on the actions of superheroes. Superheroes are individuals who possess extraordinary (superhuman) abilities, and are dedicated to protecting the public. These films typically feature action, adventure, fantasy, and/or science fiction elements. The first film of a particular character often focuses on the hero's origin story, the story of how they got their special powers and often introduces the hero's nemesis. (Source: wikipedia.org)
